component.name: Rust4Diva
component.summary: Cross platform mod manager for Project Diva Mega Mix+

description.p: Cross platform mod manager for Project Diva Mega Mix+ Supports in app mod downloads. Oneclick downloads from gamebanana.com. (supported on linux/steam deck, and windows)

ul.li: Simplified Chinese Translation (Thanks hiki8man)
Spanish Translation (Thanks Plex_Main)
Updated Japanese Translation (Thanks Azuki3)
Added an option to display mod's by their folder name instead of config name
Override translations by placing a new file in the `langs` config folder
Basic Translations (Supported languages: English, 日本語)
Fixed bug that caused extra settings in mod config.toml to be removed
search installed mods and mods that are in the current pack
Option to follow system color scheme
Option to set custom scale factor
It is now possible to add more than one mod with the same name to a pack
Fix DML version getting forgotten after relaunching Rust4Diva
Bad scaling on Large Hiresolution screens
DMM Loadouts imported into the wrong directory
Changing Mod Packs crashes on windows
Grid view and list view with more info and even a preview image
Searches now open into a new window that'll display more information and list it's available files for you to choose from
You can now specify multiple Mega Mix installs and switch between them.
Rust4Diva can now install and update DML directly within the app

description.p: Overhauled Mod Management and Mod Pack screen

ul.li: The mod management and mod packs tabs have been combined into a single tab
Default `All Mods` pack that will always contain all of your installed mods
Add additional modpacks to save enabled states and ensure that you are only running the mods you want to run.
Drag'n'Drop to change mod priority
In App Mod config editor
There is now a button to delete an installed mod (There is a confirmation Dialog)
Added a first time setup screen (this will be displayed to existing users on first launch of the update)
QoL Change: Hold modifier keys to change how far a mod is moved when using the priority buttons
QoL: Dark Mode Toggle
On first run a window will be displayed confirming some settings
There is an option to import from DMM (Diva Mod Manager)
DMM loadouts are imported as modpacks and the last activated loadout is used as the global priority
